adrFormatAddress: 1827-1833, 1st Ave., New York, NY 10128, USA

originalText.text: It's always the customer service for me. I work in the city so I'm use to parking my car and receiving an upcharge because my vehicle is an oversized SUV. For example if the parking says $20 I can expect to pay $30 because they almost always charge me extra. So anyway. I enter this establishment and the first thing is say is, " Good Morning. What are your rates?" Without answering my question, the attendant ask when will I be back? I say about 2:15pm(it was 6am). The attendant then walks away and types something in a computer and comes back with a claim ticket and says leave the keys in the car. I again repeat thinking maybe he didn't hear me ask the first time, "oh sorry, what are your rates for my vehicle?" This guy rolls his eyes and says there's a big sign outside and shakes his head. HOW RUDE??!!! I say well I saw the sign but I only wanted to make sure there was no additional fee for my size truck. He continues to shake his head, turned his back to me and walked away. I swear if I wasn't cutting it so close to clocking in time I would have drove to another lott and paid extra. I hope management sees this and corrects it! You can beat prices but if customer service sucks you will loose business. I will be sure to tell my co workers to steer clear of this place.nAll thanks to whoever was working the a.m shift on today, 3/25/21 ...tried taking his picture but it blurred

originalText.text: I had a bad customer service experience with Eduardo.  Let me start with how I set up my parking.  I only needed parking for one month.  The first representative was very polite and helped me set up my parking for one month starting on April 14th.  Everything was fine until I received a due invoice on May 6th for the month of May for an additional $113.33.  I brought the invoice to Eduardo to hopefully have it  canceled since I had already payed for my parking for one month.  Eduardo then tells me that the billing cycle begins on the first of every month and that my $200 was only for the time in April.  I explained to him that the previous rep had set me up for one month from April 14th at $200.  Eduardo told me that the rep was wrong and I would have to pay regardless of rep's mistake.  This alone was very rude and unprofessional.  I then asked how I could be set up for monthly billing when I never signed a contract.  He brings me a blank contract and says "You never signed this?"  I told him "No, and it makes sense considering the previous rep was only setting me up for one month."  Eduardo then tries to make me believe that the profile form I filled out with my name and vehicle information; was a contract.  This was a blatant lie.  I told him that I actually went to law school so I know exactly what a contract is.  The form has no terms or conditions.  It didn't even list any pricing.  Eduardo is either very uneducated in professional conduct in a work environment.  I ended up having to contact the corporate headquarters directly before the issue was resolved.  This was a horrible experience.

originalText.text: Stole my emergency cash I had forgotten to take out. Do not trust this location.
